sentence.str: Breast cancer exhibits familial aggregation, consistent with variation in genetic susceptibility to the disease.

argument.dependent: in genetic susceptibility to the disease

sentence.str: Known susceptibility genes account for less than 25_% of the familial risk of breast cancer, and the residual genetic variance is likely to be due to variants conferring more moderate risks.

argument.dependent: for less than unk % of the familial risk of breast cancer
to be due to variants conferring more moderate risks

sentence.str: To identify further susceptibility alleles, we conducted a two-stage genome-wide association study in 4,398 breast cancer cases and 4,316 controls, followed by a third stage in which 30 single nucleotide polymorphisms ( SNPs ) were tested for confirmation in 21,860 cases and 22,578 controls from S22 studies.

argument.dependent: a two-stage genome-wide association study in unk breast cancer cases and unk controls
a two-stage genome-wide association study in unk breast cancer cases and unk controls
in which 30 single nucleotide polymorphisms ( snps )
for confirmation in unk cases and unk controls from s22 studies
in unk cases and unk controls from s22 studies

sentence.str: We used 227,876 SNPs that were estimated to correlate with 77_% of known common SNPs in Europeans at r2 0.5.

argument.dependent: unk snps that were estimated to correlate with unk % of known common snps in europeans at r2 0.5
to correlate with unk % of known common snps in europeans at r2 0.5

sentence.str: SNPs in five novel independent loci exhibited strong and consistent evidence of association with breast cancer ( P 10 ( -7 ) ).

argument.dependent: snps in five novel independent loci
strong and consistent evidence of association with breast cancer ( p 10 ( -7 ) )
evidence of association with breast cancer

sentence.str: Four of these contain plausible causative genes ( FGFR2, TNRC9, MAP3K1 and LSP1 ).

argument.dependent: genes ( unk , unk , unk and unk )

sentence.str: At the second stage, 1,792 SNPs were significant at the P 0.05 level compared with an estimated 1,343 that would be expected by_chance, indicating that many additional common susceptibility alleles may be identifiable by this approach.

argument.dependent: at the p 0.05 level compared with an estimated 1,343 that would be expected unk
with an estimated 1,343 that would be expected unk
that would be expected unk , indicating that many additional common susceptibility alleles may be identifiable by this approach
that many additional common susceptibility alleles may be identifiable by this approach

sentence.str: Breast cancer is about twice as common in the first-degree relatives of women with the disease as in the general population, consistent with variation in genetic susceptibility to the disease1.

argument.dependent: in genetic susceptibility to the unk

sentence.str: In the 1990s, two major susceptibility genes for breast cancer, BRCA1 and BRCA2, were identified.

argument.dependent: susceptibility genes for breast cancer , brca1 and brca2
two major susceptibility genes for breast cancer

sentence.str: Inherited mutations in these genes lead to a high risk of breast and other cancers.

argument.dependent: to a high risk of breast and other cancers
risk of breast and other cancers

sentence.str: However, the majority of multiple case breast cancer families do not segregate mutations in these genes.
Subsequent genetic linkage studies have failed to identify further major breast cancer genes.

argument.dependent: to identify further major breast cancer genes

sentence.str: These observations have led to the proposal that breast cancer susceptibility is largely ‘ polygenic ’: that is, susceptibility is conferred by a large number of loci, each with a small effect on breast cancer risk.

argument.dependent: to the proposal that breast cancer susceptibility is largely unk polygenic unk

sentence.str: This model is consistent with the observed patterns of familial aggregation of breast cancer.

argument.dependent: patterns of familial aggregation of breast cancer
of familial aggregation of breast cancer

sentence.str: However, progress in identifying the relevant loci has been slow.

argument.dependent: progress in identifying the relevant loci

sentence.str: As linkage studies lack power to detect alleles with moderate effects on risk, large case-control association studies are required.

argument.dependent: power to detect alleles with moderate effects on risk , large case-control association studies are required
alleles with moderate effects on risk , large case-control association studies are required
on risk , large case-control association studies
as linkage studies lack power to detect alleles with moderate effects on risk , large case-control association studies

sentence.str: Such studies have identified variants in the DNA repair genes CHEK2 ​, ATM ​, BRIP1 and PALB2that confer an approximately twofold risk of breast cancer, but these variants are rare in the population -.
A recent study has shown that a common coding variant in CASP8 is associated with a moderate reduction in breast cancer risk.

argument.dependent: that a common coding variant in unk is associated with a moderate reduction in breast cancer risk
a common coding variant in unk
with a moderate reduction in breast cancer risk

sentence.str: After accounting for all the known breast cancer loci, more than 75_% of the familial risk of the disease remains unexplained.

argument.dependent: accounting for all the known breast cancer loci , more than unk % of the familial risk of the disease
for all the known breast cancer loci
after accounting for all the known breast cancer loci ,
more than unk % of the familial risk of the disease

sentence.str: Recent technological advances have provided platforms that allow hundreds of thousands of SNPs to be analysed in association studies, thus providing a basis for identifying moderate risk alleles without prior knowledge of position or function.

argument.dependent: platforms that allow hundreds of thousands of snps to be analysed in association studies
hundreds of thousands of snps to be analysed in association studies
to be analysed in association studies
a basis for identifying moderate risk alleles without prior knowledge of position or function

sentence.str: It has been estimated that there are 7_million common SNPs in the human genome ( with minor allele frequency, m. a. f., 5_% ).

argument.dependent: that there are unk common snps in the human genome ( with minor allele frequency , m. a. f. ,
there are unk common snps in the human genome

sentence.str: However, because recombination tends to occur at distinct ‘ hot-spots ’, neighbouring polymorphisms are often strongly correlated ( in ‘ linkage disequilibrium ’, LD ) with each other.
The majority of common genetic variants can therefore be evaluated for association using a few hundred thousand SNPs as tags for all the other variants.

argument.dependent: the majority of common genetic variants
therefore be evaluated for association using a few hundred thousand snps as tags for all the other variants
a few hundred thousand snps as tags

sentence.str: We aimed to identify further breast cancer susceptibility loci in a three-stage association study.

argument.dependent: to identify further breast cancer susceptibility loci in a three-stage association study
further breast cancer susceptibility loci in a three-stage association study

sentence.str: In the first stage, we used a panel of 266,722 SNPs, selected to tag known common variants across the entire genome18.

argument.dependent: we used a panel of unk snps , selected to tag known common variants across the entire unk
to tag known common variants across the entire unk
common variants across the entire unk

sentence.str: These SNPs were genotyped in 408 breast cancer cases and 400 controls from the UK ; data were analysed for 390 cases and 364 controls genotyped for ≥ 80_% of the SNPs.

argument.dependent: for 390 cases and 364 controls unk for unk unk % of the snps

sentence.str: The cases were selected to have a strong family history of breast cancer, equivalent to at_least two affected female first-degree relatives, because such cases are more likely to carry susceptibility alleles.
Initally, we analysed 227,876 SNPs ( 85_% ) with genotypes on at_least 80_% of the subjects.

argument.dependent: unk snps ( unk % ) with genotypes on unk unk % of the subjects

sentence.str: We estimate that these SNPs are correlated with 58_% of common SNPs in the HapMap_CEPH / CEU ( Utah residents with ancestry from northern and western Europe ) samples at r2 0.8, and 77_% at r2 0.5 ( mean r2=0.75 ; see Supplementary_Fig. 1 ) ( http://www.hapmap.org/ ).

argument.dependent: that these snps are correlated with unk % of common snps in the unk / ceu ( utah residents with ancestry from northern and western europe ) samples at r2 0.8 , and unk % at r2 0.5
residents with ancestry from northern and western europe ) samples at r2 0.8 ,

sentence.str: As expected, coverage was strongly related to m. a. f.: 70_% of SNPs with m. a. f. 10_% were tagged at r2 0.8, compared with 23_% of SNPs with m. a. f. 5 – 10_%.

argument.dependent: with unk % of snps with m. a. f. 5 unk unk %

sentence.str: The main analyses were restricted to 205,586 SNPs that had a call rate of 90_% and whose genotype distributions did not differ from Hardy – Weinberg equilibrium in controls ( at P 10 − 5 ).

argument.dependent: of unk % and whose genotype distributions did not differ from hardy unk weinberg equilibrium in controls ( at p
a call rate of unk % and whose genotype distributions

sentence.str: For the second stage we selected 12,711 SNPs, approximately 5_% of those typed in stage 1, on the basis of the significance of the difference in genotype frequency between cases and controls.

argument.dependent: unk % of those typed in stage
of the difference in genotype frequency between cases and controls
the basis of the significance of the difference in genotype

sentence.str: These SNPs were then genotyped in a further 3,990 invasive breast cancer cases and 3,916 controls from the SEARCH study, using a custom-designed oligonucleotide array.
In the main analyses, we considered 10,405 SNPs with call rate of 95_% that did not deviate from Hardy – Weinberg equilibrium in controls.

argument.dependent: unk snps with call rate of unk % that did not deviate from hardy unk weinberg equilibrium in controls
from hardy unk weinberg equilibrium in controls

sentence.str: Comparison of the observed and expected distribution of test statistics showed some evidence for an inflation of the test statistics in both stage 1 ( inflation factor λ=1.03, 95_% confidence interval ( CI ) 1.02 – 1.04 ) and stage 2 ( λ=1.06, 95_% CI 1.04 – 1.12 ), based on the 90_% least significant SNPs ( Fig. 1 ).

argument.dependent: distribution of test statistics showed some evidence for an inflation of the test statistics in both stage 1 ( inflation
distribution of test statistics showed some evidence for an inflation of the test statistics in both stage 1 ( inflation
comparison of the observed and expected distribution of test statistics

for an inflation of the test statistics in both stage

sentence.str: Possible explanations for this inflation include population stratification, cryptic relatedness among subjects, and differential genotype calling between cases and controls.

argument.dependent: population stratification , cryptic relatedness among subjects , and differential genotype calling between cases and controls

sentence.str: There was evidence for an excess of low call rate SNPs among the most significant SNPs ( P 0.01 ) in stage 1, but not in stage 2, suggesting that some of this effect is a genotyping artefact ( Supplementary_Table 1 ).

that some of this effect is a genotyping artefact ( unk 1 )

sentence.str: However, the inflation was still present among SNPs with call rate 99_% in both cases and controls, possibly reflecting population sub-structure.

among snps with call rate unk % in both cases and controls

sentence.str: We computed 1 degree of freedom ( d. f. ) association tests for each SNP, combining stages 1 and 2.
After adjustment for this inflation by the genomic control method, we observed more associations than would have been expected by_chance at P 0.05 ( Table 1 ).

we observed more associations than would have been expected unk at p 0.05 ( table 1 )

sentence.str: One SNP ( dbSNP rs2981582 ) was significant at the P 10 − 7 level that has been proposed as appropriate for genome-wide studies.
